author: joget
title: Accelerating Enterprise Adoption
description: Construir aplicações empresariais e institucionais descentralizadas é muito complexo, demorado, caro e requer habilidades especiais e escassas.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of foundational registry solutions being difficult to create by an easy to use visual dApp builder with foundational registry templates which aligns with the challenge goals.   
The proposal is an excellent example of articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem, articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges, providing key metrics and goals that closely align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of evidence of experience (web links), team composition, budget is broken down and reasonable, realistic timetable and plan, 
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by a challenges and risks section.
The proposal is an excellent example of detailed technical explanation of the solution with videos and tutorials.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes a clear understandable description of the targeted problem.
The proposal is an excellent example of a roadmap, milestones, time horizon, metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success, and a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: Due to both my past political engagement and having lived in different countries with different approaches to administration on a governmental level, I have experienced, discussed and thought about this topic a lot. In addition to this, I have an understanding of budgeting, both due to my past engagement as a treasurer in a political organisation and my current work as a project engineer, which will give me a good grasp of realistic budgeting of projects. The proposal presents a great application to facilitate the development of dAPPS and empower citizen developers. It matches the challenge great. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since WADA is a great multiplicator and keeps establishing, and the related business seems serious and credible, it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
WADA are a really active and established part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt they and their project partners will be able to successfully implement this proposal. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large group as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Well-defined, detailed metrics and an auditable roadmap are presented that define the success of the proposal. A clear, understandable problem description is accompanied by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0: Great proposal and idea. The component of local input is useful. This gives stakeholders in Africa to develop what really suits them and apply their own local knowledge in developing their solutions. I would be glad to see this proposal in motion.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has great experience that would be useful for implementing the project. I think the proposal has clear and specific goal which gives focus to their activities. I think the proposal can be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I like the team's openness. The proposal has a well-defined success and is traceable for auditing. The budget breakdown is useful to know what activities are being funded and at what face.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well laid out and clearly addresses the way to overcome the lack of expertise people hold in building enterprise and institutional decentralized applications. The proposal includes a provision to provide a simplified user interface to help the newcomers in the ecosystem leverage the capability of Cardano, thus escalating the adoption of the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has provided the readers with an elucidated action plan with lucid milestones. The team has proven experience and has the required skills. They have already developed and deployed a beta version of this technology which enables the rapid adoption, development, and deployment of applications on the Cardano blockchain. The proposal also narrates a detailed budget breakdown and the required funds of 75k USD seem reasonable and practical.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal also comes with ample information on the possible KPI that auditors can use to track the progress of the proposal. The action plan also has metric goals for each quarter which simplifies the audit and tracking progress. The milestones and metrics are acceptable to track the success of the proposal and how impactful it has been in escalating the adoption of the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: No-code app tooling is where most governmental agencies are migrating towards as they look to in house more rapid application development (RAD) opportunities within the Agile framework.
f6_assessments.q1: The Jorget team has experience building no-code wrapper solutions to enable streamlined blockchain app development. The WADA team has built a network of operators and developers in the west Africa region. The action plan KPI's presented and existing Jorget solutions add to the proposal's robustness.
f6_assessments.q2: The information presented all throughout this proposal is sufficient to audit the progress.

solution: Vamos estender nosso plugin Cardano para permitir que os desenvolvedores empresariais e cidadãos desenvolvam rapidamente e escalem dapps usando recursos de arrastar e soltar.
experience: Ministério da Fazenda, França; Ministério do Comércio Exterior, EAU; Boeing, EUA; BP Exploration, Índia; Hong Kong Monetary Authority, Hong Kong
